item.description:
When you hear about earthquakes, hurricanes, medical emergencies, terror attacks, & other tragic events, are you someone who wants to actually do something to help - but you don't know what to do?

Learn the skills needed to take care of your family and your community in the event of an emergency through the...

Community Emergency Preparedness Class!

This free course includes topics such as: disaster preparedness, disaster psychology, fire safety, safety strategies involved in a terrorist incident, Incident Command Systems, search and rescue, as well as first aid and CPR certification through the American Heart Association.

The class is sponsored by the Health & Safety Council of Strafford County, and taught by expert fire department personnel and others.

Location: Durham Fire Dept. 51 College Rd. Durham, NH 6:30-8:30pm

Space is limited.

 

YOU MUST REGISTER IN ADVANCE!

Contact Samantha Brann: 603/335-0168 or 603/565-2297

at the Health & Safety Council of Strafford County.

...and tell her that Larry Pilla referred you!

 

People with medical training are encouraged to participate - but no specialized medical or other training is required.

Samantha will direct you to this website: https://www.nhrespond...

~Click on the NH ESAR-VHP Registration button.

~If you have no prior medical training, select "non-medical volunteer".

~Once you register, you'll be able to sign up for the class. Click on "Search Open Sessions"

If you have any questions, contact Samantha Brann: 603/335-0168 or 603/565-2297

This course will be offered again in Portsmouth in the spring.

Ask Samantha for details.

 

 

Liability Release

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, snow sports, alcohol consumption, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.


Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.
item.name: Free Community Emergency Preparedness Class!
